article.headline: Montana State 98, Idaho State 87
article.story: POCATELLO, Idaho (AP) -- Senior center Al Beye scored a career-high 29 points, including 19 in the first half, as Montana State powered past Idaho State 98-87 Thursday night. The teams traded leads for most of the first half and neither led by more than five points until Idaho State (9-11, 1-7 Big Sky) closed with a 12-2 run to grab a 52-43 halftime lead. Beye was unstoppable early on for Montana State (13-9, 6-2), and he shot 9-for-12 from the field in the first half. Meanwhile, Idaho State put on a free throw-shooting clinic, hitting 18-of-18 from the line in the game's first 20 minutes. Montana State opened the second half with a 13-3 run to take a 56-55 lead. Idaho State responded with a 10-0 run of its own to regain a nine-point advantage, then Montana State scored the next eight points and cut the Bengals' lead to 65-64. Idaho State guard Tim Henry hit a 3-pointer with nine minutes left to give the Bengals a 74-71 lead, but Montana State took control of the game from there. Over the next eight minutes, the Bobcats outscored Idaho State 27-6, holding the Bengals to just one field goal during that time and opening up a 98-80 lead. ISU scored seven points in the final minute. Beye was one of four Montana State players in double figures. Marvin Moss had 15 points, seven rebounds and seven assists, Jacques Wilson added 14 points and Ja'Ron Jefferson chipped in 13. Logan Kinghorn, David Schroeder and Ryan Baumgartner each had 16 points for Idaho State.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
